Package slogo.compiler

Class Parser

java.lang.Object
slogo.compiler.Parser
public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
The Parser class takes user inputs and converts them into SLogoToken objects of the correct type. This class simply splits String inputs by blank spaces and performs no syntax related error checking. While parsing, if the beginning of a SLogoList is encountered, the corresponding token will be created and all tokens until the list closing token is found. While parsing, any String matching [a-zA-Z_]+(\?)? will be used to search for a valid SLogoCommand. If no runnable object with that name is found, a generic SLogoToken will be created and the compiler will be responsible for checking whether a SLogoRunnable with the same name exists in the Workspace. The parser is initialized with the language it has to interpret in. This language is read from a .properties file in the src.resources.languages folder.

  • Constructor Details

    • Parser

      public Parser​(java.lang.String language, Workspace workspace)
      Constructs a parser with the specified language. This determines which ResourceBundle is loaded and which language the user can code in. This constructor also builds Maps of String and Patterns that connect user input values to string descriptions of classes to generate.
      Parameters:
      language - the desired language of the compiler.

  • Method Details

    • parseInput

      public java.util.Queue<SLogoToken> parseInput​(java.lang.String inputString)
      Parses all user input and creates the corresponding SLogoTokens, placing them in a Queue. The input can contain whitespace and newline characters. The method first breaks the strings into lines, then into individual space delimited strings. If a "#" character is encountered, the entire line is ignored.
      Parameters:
      inputString - a user input SLogo code
      Returns:
      a Queue of SLogoToken objects.

    • createTokenFromString

      public SLogoToken createTokenFromString​(java.lang.String userInput) throws SLogoException
      Creates SLogoToken of the correct types from given String. If the token type is of SLogoCommand, then the correct subclass of Command will be created. If no corresponding SLogoToken or SLogoCommand is found, this method will attempt to find a WorkspaceEntry in the Workspace that has a name matching the user input. If none is found in the workspace, an exception will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      userInput -
      Returns:
      the SLogoToken of the correct type.
      Throws:
      SLogoException

    • determineTokenType

      private java.lang.String determineTokenType​(java.lang.String userInput) throws SLogoException
      Determines the proper name describing the SLogoToken from a user input string. Returns null if the user input doesn't match any existing pattern.
      Parameters:
      userInput - a string that does not contain any blank space.
      Returns:
      a String of the proper name of a SLogoToken or null
      Throws:
      SLogoException

    • determineCommandType

      private java.lang.String determineCommandType​(java.lang.String userInput)
      Attempts to find the String command name matching the user input. If not found, the input might be a user defined function, therefore return the user input as is.
      Parameters:
      userInput - String user typed text
      Returns:
      either the proper SLogoCommand name or the user input as is.

    • getKeyFromRegex

      private java.lang.String getKeyFromRegex​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.regex.Pattern> regexMap, java.lang.String userInput)
      Searches the given Map for any value Patterns that has a regex match with userInput string. If there is a match, returns the String key of the corresponding pattern. If not, returns null. The input map's keySet is searched in order of descending string length because regex finds the first matching String, even if it is a substring. Therefore, ordering the set in reverse eliminates the possibility of getting the key for "or" when the user input is "for", for example.
      Parameters:
      regexMap - a map containing String and Pattern pairs
      userInput - the String to search for in the map
      Returns:
      returns String match from the map, or null if none is found.

    • createRegexMap

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.regex.Pattern> createRegexMap​(java.util.ResourceBundle bundle)
      Creates a HashMap of String and Pattern pairs so that the a used input string can be searched against the list of keys.
      Parameters:
      bundle - ResourceBundle object to use to create the map
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing String and Pattern pairs.
